title: Dr. Sam Hall-McMaster
text:
Dr. Sam Hall-McMaster





I am a neuroscientist at Harvard University. I use human brain measurements and computational tools to make discoveries about motivation, decision-making and eating disorders.
I completed a PhD at the University of Oxford and a BSc back home in Aotearoa.

title: Sam Hall-McMaster
text:
About
I am cognitive neuroscientist at Harvard University. My research uses human brain measurements, computational models and statistical tools to make discoveries about motivation, decision-making, and disordered eating.

title: Sam Hall-McMaster
text:
Human intelligence is flexible, but where does this flexibility come from? My research investigates the neural coding schemes and computational algorithms that the brain uses to generate flexible and intelligent behaviour.
I am a New Zealand scientist based at Harvard University. My research uses human brain measurements, computational models and statistical tools to make discoveries about motivation, decision-making, and disordered eating.
I completed a DPhil at the University of Oxford and a BSc(Hons) at the University of Otago in Aotearoa New Zealand.
